contextReaction.pl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 =head1 NAME
00002 
00003 contextReaction.pl - Implements a MathObject class for checmical reactions.
00004 
00005 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00006 
00007 This file implements a Context in which checmical reactions can be
00008 specified and compared.  Reactions can be composed of sums of integer
00009 multiples of elements (possibly with subscripts), separated by a right
00010 arrow (indicated by "-->").  Helpful error messages are given when a
00011 reaction is not of the correct form.  Sums of compounds can be given
00012 in any order, but the elements within a compound must be in the order
00013 given by the correct answer; e.g., if the correct answer specifies
00014 CO_2, then O_2C would be marked incorrect.
00015 
00016 To use the context include
00017 
00018     loadMacros("contextReaction.pl");
00019     Context("Reaction");
00020 
00021 at the top of your PG file, then create Formula() objects for your
00022 reactions.  For example:
00023 
00024     $R = Formula("4P + 5O_2 --> 2P_2O_5");
00025 
00026 Reactions know how to create their own TeX versions (via $R->TeX), and
00027 know how to check student answers (via $R->cmp), just like any other
00028 MathObject.
00029 
00030 The Reaction Context also allows you to create parts of reactions.
00031 E.g., you could create
00032 
00033     $products = Formula("4CO_2 + 6H_2O");
00034 
00035 which you could use in a problem as follows:
00036 
00037     loadMacros("contextReaction.pl");
00038     Context("Reaction");
00039     
00040     $reactants = Formula("2C_2H_6 + 7O_2");
00041     $products  = Formula("4CO_2 + 6H_2O");
00042     
00043     Context()->texStrings;
00044     BEGIN_TEXT
00045     \($reactants \longrightarrow\) \{ans_rule(30)\}.
00046     END_TEXT
00047     Context()->normalStrings;
00048     
00049     ANS($products->cmp);
00050 
00051 Note that sums and products are not simplified in any way, so that
00052 Formula("O + O") and Formula("2O") and Formula("O_2") are all
00053 different and unequal in this context.
00054 
00055 All the elements of the periodic table are available within the
00056 Reaction Context.  If you need additional terms, like "Heat" for
00057 example, you can add them as variables:
00058 
00059     Context()->variables->add(Heat => $context::Reaction::CONSTANT);
00060 
00061 Then you can make formulas that include Heat as a term.  These
00062 "constants" are not allowed to have coefficients or subscripts, and
00063 can not be combined with compounds except by addition.  If you want a
00064 term that can be combined in those ways, use
00065 $context::Reaction::ELEMENT instead.
00066 
00067 =cut
00068 
00069 ######################################################################
00070 
00071 sub _contextReaction_init {context::Reaction::Init()}
00072 
00073 ######################################################################
00074 #
00075 #  The main MathObject class for reactions
00076 #
00077 package context::Reaction;
00078 our @ISA = ('Value::Formula');
00079 
00080 #
00081 #  Some type declarations for the various classes
00082 #
00083 our $ELEMENT  = {isValue => 1, type => Value::Type("Element",1)};
00084 our $MOLECULE = {isValue => 1, type => Value::Type("Molecule",1)};
00085 our $COMPOUND = {isValue => 1, type => Value::Type("Compound",1)};
00086 our $REACTION = {isValue => 1, type => Value::Type("Reaction",1)};
00087 our $CONSTANT = {isValue => 1, type => Value::Type("Constant",1)};
00088 
00089 #
00090 #  Set up the context and Reaction() constructor
00091 #
00092 sub Init {
00093   my $context = $main::context{Reaction} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00094   $context->functions->clear();
00095   $context->strings->clear();
00096   $context->constants->clear();
00097   $context->lists->clear();
00098   $context->lists->add(
00099    'List' => {class =>'context::Reaction::List::List', open => '', close => '', separator => ' + '},
00100   );
00101   $context->parens->clear();
00102   $context->parens->add(
00103    '(' => {close => ')', type => 'List', formList => 1, removable => 1},
00104    '{' => {close => '}', type => 'List', removable => 1},
00105   );
00106   $context->operators->clear();
00107   $context->operators->set(
00108    '-->' => {precedence => 1, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' --> ',
00109            class => 'context::Reaction::BOP::arrow', TeX => " \\longrightarrow "},
00110 
00111    '+' => {precedence => 2, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' + ',
00112            class => 'context::Reaction::BOP::add', isComma => 1},
00113 
00114    ' ' => {precedence => 3, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' ',
00115            class => 'context::Reaction::BOP::multiply', hidden => 1},
00116 
00117    '_' => {precedence => 4, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => '_',
00118            class => 'context::Reaction::BOP::underscore'},
00119 
00120    '-' => {precedence => 5, associativity => 'left', type => 'both', string => ' - ',
00121            class => 'Parser::BOP::undefined'},
00122    'u-'=> {precedence => 6, associativity => 'left', type => 'unary', string => '-',
00123            class => 'Parser::UOP::undefined', hidden => 1},
00124   );
00125   $context->variables->are(
00126     map {$_ => $ELEMENT} (
00127       "H",                                                                                   "He",
00128       "Li","Be",                                                    "B", "C", "N", "O", "F", "Ne",
00129       "Na","Mg",                                                    "Al","Si","P", "S", "Cl","Ar",
00130       "K", "Ca",  "Sc","Ti","V", "Cr","Mn","Fe","Co","Ni","Cu","Zn","Ga","Ge","As","Se","Br","Kr",
00131       "Rb","Sr",  "Y", "Zr","Nb","Mo","Tc","Ru","Rh","Pd","Ag","Cd","In","Sn","Sb","Te","I", "Xe",
00132       "Cs","Ba",  "Lu","Hf","Ta","W", "Re","Os","Ir","Pt","Au","Hg","Ti","Pb","Bi","Po","At","Rn",
00133       "Fr","Ra",  "Lr","Rf","Db","Sg","Bh","Hs","Mt","Ds","Rg","Cn","Uut","Uuq","Uup","Uuh","Uus","Uuo",
00134 
00135                   "La","Ce","Pr","Nd","Pm","Sm","Eu","Gd","Tb","Dy","Ho","Er","Tm","Yb",
00136                   "Ac","Th","Pa","U", "Np","Pu","Am","Cm","Bk","Cf","Es","Fm","Md","No",
00137     )
00138   );
00139   $context->{parser}{Number} = "context::Reaction::Number";
00140   $context->{parser}{Variable} = "context::Reaction::Variable";
00141   $context->{parser}{Formula} = "context::Reaction";
00142   $context->{value}{Reaction} = "context::Reaction";
00143   $context->{value}{Element} = "context::Reaction::Variable";
00144   $context->{value}{Constant} = "context::Reaction::Variable";
00145   Parser::Number::NoDecimals($context);
00146 
00147   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub Reaction {Value->Package("Formula")->new(@_)};');
00148 }
00149 
00150 #
00151 #  Compare by checking of the trees are equivalent
00152 #
00153 sub compare {
00154   my ($l,$r) = @_; my $self = $l;
00155   my $context = $self->context;
00156   $r = $context->Package("Formula")->new($context,$r) unless Value::isFormula($r);
00157   return ($l->{tree}->equivalent($r->{tree}) ? 0 : 1);
00158 }
00159 
00160 #
00161 #  Don't allow evaluation
00162 #
00163 sub eval {
00164   my $self = shift;
00165   $self->Error("Can't evaluate ".$self->TYPE);
00166 }

00169 #  Provide a useful name

00171 sub TYPE {'a chemical reaction'}
00172 sub cmp_class {'a Chemical Reaction'}

00174 #
00175 #  Set up the answer checker.  Avoid the list checker in
00176 #    Value::Formula::cmp_equal (for when the answer is a
00177 #    sum of compounds) and provide a postprocessor to
00178 #    give warnings when a reaction is compared to a
00179 #    student answer that isn't a reaction.
00180 #
00181 sub cmp_defaults {(showTypeWarnings => 1)}
00182 sub cmp_equal {Value::cmp_equal(@_)};
00183 sub cmp_postprocess {
00184   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift;
00185   return unless $self->{tree}->type eq 'Reaction';
00186   $self->cmp_Error($ans,"Your answer doesn't seem to be a reaction\n(it should contain a reaction arrow '-->')")
00187     if $ans->{showTypeWarnings} && $ans->{student_value}{tree}->type ne 'Reaction';
00188 }
00189 
00190 #
00191 #  Since the context only allows things that are comparable, we
00192 #  don't really have to check anything.  (But if somone added
00193 #  strings or constants, we would.)
00194 #
00195 sub typeMatch {
00196   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00197   return 1;
00198 }

00201 #
00202 #  The replacement for the Parser:Number class
00203 #
00204 package context::Reaction::Number;
00205 our @ISA = ('Parser::Number');
00206 
00207 #
00208 #  Equivalent is equal
00209 #
00210 sub equivalent {
00211   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00212   return 0 unless $other->class eq 'Number';
00213   return $self->eval == $other->eval;
00214 }

00221 ######################################################################
00222 #
00223 #  The replacement for Parser::Variable.  We hold the elements here.
00224 #
00225 package context::Reaction::Variable;
00226 our @ISA = ('Parser::Variable');
00227 
00228 #
00229 #  Two elements are equivalent if their names are equal
00230 #
00231 sub equivalent {
00232   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00233   return 0 unless $other->class eq 'Variable';
00234   return $self->{name} eq $other->{name};
00235 }

00244 sub TeX {

00251 #
00252 #  For a printable name, use a constant's name,
00253 #  and 'an element' for an element.
00254 #
00255 sub TYPE {
00256   my $self = shift;
00257   return ($self->type eq 'Constant'? "'$self->{name}'" : 'an element');
00258 }

00260 ######################################################################
00261 #
00262 #  General binary operator (add, multiply, arrow, and underscore
00263 #  are subclasses of this).
00264 #
00265 package context::Reaction::BOP;
00266 our @ISA = ('Parser::BOP');
00267 
00268 #
00269 #  Binary operators produce chemcicals (unless overridden, as in arrow)
00270 #
00271 sub isChemical {1}
00272 
00273 sub eval {context::Reaction::eval(@_)}
00274 
00275 #
00276 #  Two nodes are equivalent if their operands are equivalent
00277 #  and they have the same operator
00278 #
00279 sub equivalent {
00280   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00281   return 0 unless $other->class eq 'BOP';
00282   return 0 unless $self->{bop} eq $other->{bop};
00283   return $self->{lop}->equivalent($other->{lop}) && $self->{rop}->equivalent($other->{rop});
00284 }
00285 
00286 ######################################################################
00287 #
00288 #  Implements the --> operator
00289 #
00290 package context::Reaction::BOP::arrow;
00291 our @ISA = ('context::Reaction::BOP');
00292 
00293 #
00294 #  It is a reaction, not a chemical
00295 #
00296 sub isChemical {0}
00297 
00298 #
00299 #  Check that the operands are correct.
00300 #
00301 sub _check {
00302   my $self = shift;
00303   $self->Error("The left-hand side of '-->' must be a (sum of) reactants, not %s",
00304                $self->{lop}->TYPE) unless $self->{lop}->isChemical;
00305   $self->Error("The right-hand side of '-->' must be a (sum of) products, not %s",
00306                $self->{rop}->TYPE) unless $self->{rop}->isChemical;
00307   $self->{type} = $REACTION->{type};
00308 }

00312 ######################################################################
00313 #
00314 #  Implements addition, which forms a list of operands, so acts like
00315 #  the Parser::BOP::comma operator
00316 #
00317 package context::Reaction::BOP::add;
00318 our @ISA = ('Parser::BOP::comma','context::Reaction::BOP');
00319 
00320 #
00321 #  Check that the operands are OK
00322 #
00323 sub _check {
00324   my $self = shift;
00325   $self->Error("Can't add %s and %s",$self->{lop}->TYPE,$self->{rop}->TYPE)
00326      unless $self->{lop}->isChemical && $self->{rop}->isChemical;
00327   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00328 }
00329 
00330 #
00331 #  Two are equivalent if they are equivalent in either order.
00332 #  (never really gets used, since these result in the creation
00333 #  of a list rather than an "add" node in the final tree.
00334 #
00335 sub equivalent {
00336   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00337   return 0 unless substr($other->class,0,3) eq 'BOP';
00338   return $self->SUPER::equivalent($other) ||
00339          ($self->{lop}->equivalent($other->{rop}) && $self->{rop}->equivalent($other->{rop}));
00340 }

00342 sub TYPE {'a sum of Compounds'}
00343 
00344 ######################################################################
00345 #
00346 #  Implements concatenation, which produces compounds or integer
00347 #  multiples of elements or molecules.
00348 #
00349 package context::Reaction::BOP::multiply;
00350 our @ISA = ('context::Reaction::BOP');
00351 
00352 #
00353 #  Check that the operands are OK
00354 #
00355 sub _check {
00356   my $self = shift;
00357   $self->Error("Can't combine %s and %s",$self->{lop}->TYPE,$self->{rop}->TYPE)
00358     unless ($self->{lop}->class eq 'Number' || $self->{lop}->isChemical) &&
00359             $self->{rop}->isChemical;
00360   $self->Error("Can't combine %s with %s",$self->{lop}{name},$self->{rop}->TYPE)
00361     if $self->{lop}->type eq 'Constant';
00362   $self->Error("Can't combine %s with %s",$self->{lop}->TYPE,$self->{rop}{name})
00363     if $self->{rop}->type eq 'Constant';
00364   $self->{type} = $COMPOUND->{type};
00365 }
00366 
00367 #
00368 #  No space in output for implied multiplication
00369 #
00370 sub string {
00371   my $self = shift;
00372   return $self->{lop}->string.$self->{rop}->string;
00373 }
00374 sub TeX {
00375   my $self = shift;
00376   return $self->{lop}->TeX.$self->{rop}->TeX;
00377 }

00381 ######################################################################
00382 #
00383 #  Implements the underscore for creating molecules
00384 #
00385 package context::Reaction::BOP::underscore;
00386 our @ISA = ('context::Reaction::BOP');
00387 
00388 #
00389 #  Check that the operands are OK
00390 #
00391 sub _check {
00392   my $self = shift;
00393   $self->Error("The left-hand side of '_' must be an element or compound, not %s",$self->{lop}->TYPE)
00394     unless $self->{lop}->type eq 'Element' || $self->{lop}->type eq 'Compound';
00395   $self->Error("The right-hand side of '_' must be a number, not %s",$self->{rop}->TYPE)
00396     unless $self->{rop}->class eq 'Number';
00397   $self->{type} = $MOLECULE->{type};
00398 }
00399 
00400 #
00401 #  Create proper TeX output
00402 #
00403 sub TeX {
00404   my $self = shift;
00405   my $left = $self->{lop}->TeX;
00406   $left = "($left)" if $self->{lop}->type eq 'Compound';
00407   return $left."_{".$self->{rop}->TeX."}";
00408 }
00409 
00410 #
00411 #  Create proper text output
00412 #
00413 sub string {
00414   my $self = shift;
00415   my $left = $self->{lop}->string;
00416   $left = "($left)" if $self->{lop}->type eq 'Compound';
00417   return $left."_".$self->{rop}->string;
00418 }

00422 ######################################################################
00423 #
00424 #  Implements sums of compounds as a list
00425 #
00426 package context::Reaction::List::List;
00427 our @ISA = ('Parser::List::List');
00428 
00429 #
00430 #  Two sums are equivalent if their terms agree in any order.
00431 #  (we check by stringifying them and sorting, then compare results)
00432 #
00433 sub equivalent {
00434   my $self = shift; my $other = shift;
00435   return 0 unless $self->length == $other->length;
00436   my @left = main::lex_sort(map {$_->string} @{$self->{coords}});
00437   my @right = main::lex_sort(map {$_->string} @{$other->{coords}});
00438   return join(',',@left) eq join(',',@right);
00439 }
00440 
00441 #
00442 #  Use "+" between entries in the list (with no parens)
00443 #
00444 sub TeX {
00445   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift; my @coords = ();
00446   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@coords,$x->TeX)}
00447   return join(' + ',@coords);
00448 }
